inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring applicants were directly supervised until the office issued a conditional or eligible clearance determination, and documenting how the individual remained supervised for the entirety of their supervised employment term before receiving a clearance determination.   During the inspection, 3 employees did not have a documented method of supervision until their background clearance determination came.

facility_name: Alliance Youth Services dba The Pointe

inspection_findings.description: Provider shall protect clients from abuse, prevent abuse
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff member exposing the clients to potential harm or acts of violence during the road rage incident. The staff members  actions allowed the other driver and clients to engage in a physical altercation resulting in acts of violence and potential harm. During the investigation inspection, client interviews substantiated that the staff member did not take any action to protect the clients.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report alleged neglect and criminal activity to law enforcement or Child Protective Services. During the inspection, through documentation review, it was observed that neither staff involved in the incident notified Child Protective Services or law enforcement.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff member failing to stop the two other clients from trying to pull the client from under the bed and allegedly kicking the client while under the bed leading to possible injuries. The staff’s lack of action created potential harm to the client.

facility_name: Alpine Academy dba Gene Smith Home

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not immediately notifying the proper investigative authorities for alleged child abuse between clients. During the inspection the provider was aware of suspected child abuse on or around 4/23/2024 but a report to the applicable investigative agency was not done until on or around 5/17/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by causing harm to clients. During the inspection clients were observed to have received frostbite due to having equipment that did not protect them from the environment.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having clothing and equipment to  protect the client from the environment. In the field clients were observed to have holes in their outer waterproof layers, sleeping bags with holes, and boots that were melted and no longer waterproof. The environment was observed to be sub freezing weather with snow on the ground.

facility_name: Avalon Hills Healthcare Inc dba Avalon Hills Residential Eating Disorders Program

inspection_findings.description: Denied applicants may not direct access to clients
inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R501-14-5(5)(a) by allowing an employee with a denied background check to have direct access to clients. During the inspection, an employee was found to still be working on site with clients with a denied background check.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a-d) by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 04/21/2025 and was not reported until 04/23/2025. 
This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 04/10/2023 & 01/07/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with rule R501-1-8(1)(f) by not having paper towels in one of the upstairs student bathrooms. During the walk through inspection, the licensor observed one of the upstairs student bathrooms was not equipped with paper towels. This is a repeat non compliance as cited on 09/21/2023 and 05/08/2023.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not completing the congregate care private placement report for the months of August or September 2024. In reviewing the private placement report, the licensor observed the program had not submitted their report for August or September 2024. This is a repeat non-compliance.

The provider is out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide client checks within 15 minutes. During client interviews and in review of surveillance video, the licensor was told and observed that a client was in a bathroom and not checked by staff for 21 minutes. The client self harmed while in the bathroom.

facility_name: Care Youth Corporation - Falcon Ridge Ranch dba Rite Of Passage Inc/Falcon Ridge Ranch

inspection_findings.description: Medication and hazardous items maintenance and storage
inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8(3) by not maintaining potentially hazardous items on-site safety when not in use. During a follow-up inspection, the investigator observed that a closet used to store cleaning chemicals was left unlocked when chemicals were not in active use.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-8(1) by not having working bathroom vents in two of the client bathrooms and having an unorganized client bedroom that had a missing mattress from the bedframe. During the inspection the licensor saw two client bathroom vents that were not working and an unorganized bedroom that had a missing mattress from the bedframe. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance by not maintaining a staff-to-client ratio of one staff to every four clients. During an investigation, provider documentation verified that on Sunday, November 10, 2024 the provider was not compliant with the required staff to student ratio for multiple hours that day.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing supervision commensurate with the behaviors of each client. During an inspection, multiple interviews disclosed and facility video coverage recorded a client with a history of impulsive behaviors was not adequately supervised while in possession of hazardous chemicals. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident to the Office of Licensing within one business day. During a complaint investigation inspection, the complaint being reviewed was identified as a critical incident that was not reported to the Office of Licensing by the provider. This is a repeat citation.

inspection_findings.description: Provider shall protect clients from abuse, prevent abuse
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by compromising the health and safety of clients and failing to protect clients from harm. During the investigation inspection, a staff member provided a client with chemicals to clean a water bottle and two additional staff failed to supervise clients using cleaning chemicals. A client intentionally added chemicals to another client’s water bottle with the intent to harm them. A third client drank from the water bottle and reported their stomach hurt. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not immediately reporting allegations of child abuse to Child Protective Services intake or law enforcement. During a complaint investigation inspection, the information gathered supported that an alleged child abuse incident occurred on 11/10/2024 and the provider reported the allegations to Child Protective Services on 11/15/2024.

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by allowing a staff member without a conditional or eligible background clearance to work without being directly supervised. During an investigation, facility video coverage recorded a staff member who required direct supervision and was not being directly supervised.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having current Provider Code of Conduct or documentation of training for staff response to client leaving program without permission in staff files within 30 days of hire. During staff file review the licensor observed that the Provider Code of Conduct was not the current form and there was no documentation of training for staff response to client leaving the program without permission.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining the required staff-to-client one to four client ratio. During the inspection the information gathered from interviews and provider documentation substantiated that staff did not provide clients with required staff to client ratio mandated for client safety during an outing on 10/26/2024. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting private placements to the Office by the fifth business day of the month for August and September 2024. During the inspection the licensor verified through QuickSight reporting that the provider had not reported private placements to the office by the fifth business day of the month for August and September 2024. This is a repeat non compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining required staff ratios. During the inspection the provider was observed to be out of staff to client ratio on 1 group staffed at 1 staff  to 8 clients. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a critical incident by the next business day.  During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 3-22-24, was not reported until 3-26-24. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to maintain a staff-to-client ratio of one staff to every four clients. The information gathered throughout the investigation substantiated that the provider was out of staff to student ratio throughout multiple shifts between 02/09/2024 and 02/22/2024.

inspection_findings.description: Maintain 1 staff to every 4 client ratio
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having enough staff to meet the required 1:4 ratio. During the inspection it was observed that the provider was out of ratio on 12/17/2023 and 12/18/2023. This is a repeat noncompliance.

inspection_findings.description: Maintain 1 staff to every 4 client ratio
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to maintain a 1 to 4 staff to student ratio and supervision. During an on-site inspection, facility video coverage and provider documentation was reviewed and multiple interviews were conducted. The evidence substantiated that the provider was out of compliance with staff to student ratio and supervision on the four shifts reviewed.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a direct care staff acting in a way that compromised clients' health and safety by neglecting to conduct required supervision checks on clients in the West House. During an inspection, the investigator observed facility video coverage of 06/20/23 from 9:30pm through the morning of 06/21/23 at 7am. The staff failed to conduct 15-minute checks on all clients in their assigned area at least 8 times.

The provider was out of compliance by a direct care staff filling out false/deceptive information on a client supervision document and statement-of-fact. During on and off-site inspections, the investigator reviewed a staff’s statement-of-fact and a client supervision log that documented supervision checks of clients were conducted every 15-minutes. The facility video coverage was reviewed and staff was observed filling out the 15-minute supervision check paperwork and did not conduct at least 8 checks.

inspection_findings.description: Direct supervision only by direct care staff
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to actively supervise a client with line-of-sight check-ins. During an inspection, documentation and an administrative interview supported that a staff did not conduct line-of-sight checks to ensure a client was in the bed. The client had left the treatment facility at approximately 9:23pm and their absence was not discovered until the following morning at approximately 7am by a client(s).

facility_name: Care Youth Corporation dba Rite Of Passage Inc/Lava Heights Academy

inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R501-19-3(3)(d)(i)(ii)&(f) by a staff member not remaining awake while on duty, not supervising appropriately to ensure client health and safety, and not performing direct supervision with line-of-sight check-ins every 15-minutes. During an investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member fell asleep, failed to supervise clients as required, and did not complete one 15-minute line-of-sight check-in. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 10/12/2022.

inspection_findings.description: Medication and hazardous items maintenance and storage
inspection_findings.text: The licensee as out of compliance with R501-1-8(3) by not storing potentially hazardous material responsibly. During the investigation hand sanitizer was left accessible to clients, with one client drinking the hand sanitizer.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting private placements to the Office by the fifth business day of the month for August and September 2024. During the inspection the licensor verified through QuickSight reporting that the provider had not reported private placements to the office by the fifth business day of the month for August and September 2024. This is a repeat non compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining staff ratios. During the inspection it was observed that the provider was out of ratios by having 2 staff supervising a group of 12 clients.

facility_name: Cascade Academy LLC dba Cascade Academy

facility_address: 1374 Red Filly Rd, Heber City, UT, 84032

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having signed intake documents or a signed consent for treatment that contained rules of the program and the client rights. At the time of inspection, none of the signed intake documents contained rules of the program or clients rights or any type of signed statements stating the client, parent or guardian received the rules of the program and the client rights. This was a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring each staff member completes all required yearly training. At the time of inspection, staff did not have yearly training on how to identify the signs and symptoms of clients presenting under the influence of substances or alcohol. This was a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring each bathroom is properly equipped with soap. At the time of inspection one of the client bathrooms did not contain soap. This was a repeat noncompliance.

facility_name: Catalyst Residential Treatment Center dba Gray House

inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-13(5)(a)-(b) by not reporting private placements to the office by the fifth business day of each month. During the file review, the licensor observed that the provider had not reported on all months of the year. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/13/2023, 02/29/2024, 03/25/2024, 2/26/2025, and 3/17/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-16(2)(a)-(q) by not having all employees trained annually on the required topics. During the file review, it was observed that some employees had not received each of the required annual trainings. This rule non-compliance is a repeat noncompliance as noted on 02/13/2023, 02/29/2024, 03/25/2024, and 2/26/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-16(1)(a)-(u) by not ensuring all employees were trained on the required pre-service training topics within 30 days of hire. During the file review, not all employees had received the necessary pre-service trainings and were past 30 days of hire. This rule was previously found out of compliance on 2/26/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-13(5)(a)-(b) by not reporting private placements to the office by the fifth business day of each month. During the file review, the licensor observed that the provider had not reported on all months of the year. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/13/2023, 02/29/2024, 03/25/2024, and 2/26/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-13(1)(a)-(h) by not having an intake assessment completed for each client surveyed with each of the required items. During the file review, the provider was unable to show that two clients surveyed had an intake assessment from the program, while a third client had an intake assessment that was missing information regarding gender identity and individualized assessment for bedroom and bathroom assignments, cultural background, and family history and dynamics. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/29/2024 and 2/26/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-11(1)(a)-(o) by not asking identified gender information on intake paperwork and not having all critical incidents stored with clients’ files. During the file review, identified gender could not be found on the intake paperwork and a client file had a known critical incident involving the client that was not stored with it. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/13/2023, 02/29/2024, and 2/26/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-10(5)(a)-(b) by not having documentation of employee training on safe food practices. During the file review, the provider was unable to show a way employees had been trained on allowances for nutritious snacks and how to accommodate clients with special dietary needs. This rule was previously found out of compliance on 2/26/2025.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-16(2)(a)-(q) by not having all employees trained annually on the required topics. During the file review, it was observed that some employees had not received each of the required annual trainings. This rule non-compliance is a repeat noncompliance as noted on 02/13/2023, 02/29/2024, and 03/25/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-15(10)(a)-(f) by not storing critical incidents with personnel files. During the file review, the provider had no way to show what critical incidents a given employee had been involved in. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/13/2023.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-13(5)(a)-(b) by not reporting private placements to the office by the fifth business day of each month. During the file review, the licensor observed that the provider had not reported on all months of the year. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/13/2023, 02/29/2024 and 03/25/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-12(5)(a)-(d) by not having a discharge plan completed for a client. During the file review, a client who had left the program over 30 days ago did not have a discharge plan. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/13/2023 and 02/29/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-11(1)(a)-(o) by not asking identified gender information on intake paperwork and not having all critical incidents stored with clients’ files. During the file review, identified gender could not be found on the intake paperwork and a client file had a known critical incident involving the client that was not stored with it. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 02/13/2023 and 02/29/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff member's not treating clients with dignity and respect.  During the inspection, multiple clients reported that certain staff have yelled and used inappropriate language directly to the clients on multiple occasions. This was a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not reporting critical incidents to the Office. During the inspection, client and staff interviews confirmed that critical incidents occurred on 08/18/2024 and 08/19/2024 that had not been reported.  This is repeat noncompliances.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not having all bathrooms stocked with hand soap, not having all prescription medication stored in its original pharmacy packaging, and not ensuring client health and safety regarding vehicle safety at the time of the inspection. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not reporting critical incidents to the office. During the inspection, client interviews revealed two critical incidents that had not been reported. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not having medication stored in original pharmacy packaging. During the inspection, the licensor observed free-floating prescription medications and medications stored in plastic baggies separate from their original pharmacy packaging. This non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by having three restrooms missing hand soap and medication out of original pharmacy packaging during the inspection. This non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff member not treating a client with dignity and being disrespectful during an incident on 02/28/2024 by insulting the client numerous times.  This non-compliance was confirmed during an inspection on 04/01/2024. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not having medication in original pharmacy packaging, and by not having the facility maintained and free of health and fire hazards. During the inspection on 2/29/2024, the licensor observed that prescription medication was not consistently being stored with its original packaging.

This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance. This rule non-compliance is a repeated non-compliance from 2/29/2024, as this non-compliance item was not resolved.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having all annual trainings completed and documented for employees. During the inspection on 2/29/2024, the licensor observed that the provider did not have documentation of multiple annual trainings, and had not done some annual trainings.

This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance. This rule non-compliance is a repeated non-compliance from 2/29/2024, as this non-compliance item was not resolved.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not consistently reporting private placements to the Office of Licensing. At the time of the inspection on 2/29/2024, multiple months of private placement reporting were absent.

This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance. This rule non-compliance is a repeated non-compliance from 2/29/2024, as this non-compliance item was not resolved.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not reporting critical incidents to the office of licensing. During the inspection on 2/29/2024, the licensor discussed various incidents with the provider that were critical incidents that had not been reported.

This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance. This rule non-compliance is a repeated non-compliance from 2/29/2024, as this non-compliance item was not resolved.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not having medication in original pharmacy packaging, and by not having the facility maintained and free of health and fire hazards. During the inspection, the licensor observed that prescription medication was not consistently being stored with its original packaging.

This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not reporting critical incidents to the office of licensing. During the inspection, the licensor discussed various incidents with the provider that were critical incidents that had not been reported.

This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report 2 separate critical incidents to Licensing.  On 08/30/2023, the investigator and licensor discovered during client and staff interviews that a critical incident occurred on 08/26/2023 and 08/28/2023.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report 3 separate critical incidents to Licensing.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not submitting a critical incident report within one business day.  The incident was discovered by the provider on 07/12/2023 and was reported to Licensing on 07/14/2023.

inspection_findings.description: Staff assigned for direct supervision shall not be counted at the same time in the ratio
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having not staff directly supervising a client on precautions.

facility_name: Catalyst Residential Treatment Center dba Red House

inspection_findings.text:
The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not ensuring that the appearance & cleanliness of the building/grounds are maintained and free from health/fire hazards and that any appliances, plumbing, electrical, HVAC, and furnishings are maintained in operating order and in a clean and safe condition. During the inspection, the licensor observed multiple items that needed repair, cleaning, or to be addressed before this site started taking on clients again, including a cracked toilet lid, a stair needing repair, a baseboard needing replacement, cleanliness concerns with one of the bathrooms,  and a few holes that needed to be patched.

This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.
The provider was out of compliance by having electrical outlet cover plates missing.

facility_name: Certs dba Kolob Canyon Residential Treatment Center

facility_address: 770 E St George Blvd, Saint George, UT, 84770

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(b) for not ensuring an allegation of abuse was reported to law enforcement and CPS within 24 hours. During the investigation inspection, the information gathered substantiated that an allegation of client-on-client abuse was not reported to law enforcement and CPS within 24 hours of the allegation made.

The provider was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(c) by not notifying a parent or legal guardian of a critical incident involving their child within 24 hrs. During an investigation inspection, the information gathered substantiated that an incident of alleged sexual activity between three clients was alleged on 06/07/2025 and reported to their parents on 06/09/2025. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 01/30/2025, 05/13/2025, and 05/27/2025.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-19-3(3)(d)(ii) by a staff member not remaining awake while on duty. During an investigation inspection, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member fell asleep while on duty when they were responsible for supervising clients in a classroom.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(c) by a staff member not ensuring a client had the right to be free from potential harm or acts of violence. During an investigation, the information substantiated that a staff physically mistreated a client. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 03/19/2024, 01/30/2025, 02/26/2025, and 03/19/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-4(5)(b) by a staff member not using behavior management techniques that emphasize de-escalation and promote self-control, self-esteem, and independence. During an investigation, the information substantiated escalated that a staff member’s inappropriate comments and actions escalated an incident.  This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 02/07/2025 and 02/26/2025.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-4(5)(g)&(i) by two staff members not using passive physical restraint as an emergency, temporary means of physical containment to protect the persons involved from immediate harm and using a physical restraint as a convenience to staff. During the investigation inspection, the information substantiated that staff conducted an unnecessary physical restraint on a client who was not an immediate harm to themselves or others. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 01/03/2024, 12/30/2024, and 01/30/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(b) by not ensuring a client had the right to be treated with dignity, respect, and fairness. During the investigation inspection, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member made an inappropriate and disrespectful statement to a client. This is repeat noncompliance that was previously noted on 05/09/2023, 11/16/2023, 02/07/2025, 04/10/2025, and 05/06/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(c) by not notifying the parent of the involved client within a 24-hour period from the time of the incident. During an investigation inspection, the information gathered from licensee records substantiated that a client rights noncompliance occurred on 05/16/2025 and was not reported to the client’s parent until 05/19/2025. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 05/13/2025.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(b) by not notifying the legal guardian of each involved client within a 24-hour period from the time of the incident. During the client file inspection clients parents and or guardians had not been notified of incidents within 24 hours. This is a repeat noncompliance as noted on 1/30/25.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(b) by a staff member not ensuring that a client was treated with dignity and respect. During an investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member yelled at and used profanity directed at a client. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 05/11/2023, 11/16/2023, and 02/07/2025.

inspection_findings.description: Provider shall protect clients from abuse, prevent abuse
inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-5(4) by a staff member acting in a way that harmed and compromised the health and safety of multiple clients. During an investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member provided and used electronic vaping devices with multiple clients, allowed a client to view sexually inappropriate photos of a minor, video recorded multiple clients engaged in physical altercations and did not intervene, and allowed clients to record themselves engaging in simulated lewd acts and other licensee prohibited actions on that staff’s cell phone. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 12/26/2023 and 02/07/2024.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(b) by a staff member not ensuring a client’s right to dignity and respect. During an investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member yelled at and told a client to shut up. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 05/09/2023, 11/16/2023, and 02/07/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(c) by not ensuring a client’s right to be free from harm or acts of violence. During the investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a client was physically harmed and injured by two clients. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 03/19/2024, 01/30/2025, 01/30/2025, 02/07/2025, and 02/26/2025.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-5(10) by not ensuring services and supervision that is commensurate with the behaviors and needs or each client. During the investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff did not provide services and supervision proportionate with clients behaviors and needs. During this time, a client was physically harmed and injured by two other clients. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 04/05/2023 and 02/07/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(c) by a staff member not ensuring a client was free from potential harm or acts of violence. During an investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff attempted to physically confront a client and threw a flip flop at a client’s head. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 03/19/2024, 01/30/2025, 01/30/2025, and 02/07/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-4(5)(b) by a staff member not using behavior management techniques that emphasize de-escalation and promote self-control. During an investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member engaged in confrontational behavior with a client rather than using de-escalation techniques. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 02/07/2025.

inspections.inspection_type: Complaint, Investigation Inspection, Non On-Site Inspection

inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-4(5)(b) by a staff member not using behavior management techniques that emphasized de-escalation and promoted self-control. During the investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member’s negative conduct exacerbated an incident that other staff members were working to de-escalate.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-5(10) by a staff member not providing supervision with the skills, behaviors, and needs of each client. During the investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a staff member was focused on a cell phone while two clients engaged in a confrontation that escalated to a physical assault. This is a repeat noncompliance as previously noted on 04/05/2023, 08/16/2023, and 12/26/2023.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(b) by a staff member not ensuring a client had the right to be treated with dignity and respect and to be free from potential harm or acts of violence. During the inspection, the information gathered substantiated a staff member engaged in a verbal and physical confrontation with a client. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 05/09/2023, 11/16/2023, 03/19/2024, 01/30/2025, and 01/30/2025.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(6) by withholding information that affected the office’s information gathering process. During the investigation, a review of an incident report submitted by the licensee was conducted. It was observed that the licensee omitted information pertinent to the context of the incident. This is a repeat noncompliance as previously noted on 01/30/2025.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff members using a physical restraint as a convenience to staff. During the investigation inspection, facility video coverage and multiple interviews substantiated that a client who was not an immediate danger to themselves or others was placed in an unnecessary physical restraint. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by violating the client’s right to be free from potential harm and acts of violence. 1. Failing to defer to the least restrictive method of behavior management available to control a situation and using behavior management techniques that were not trauma-informed and appropriate for the client’s behavior. During an off-site inspection, the Office reviewed an incident that occurred on 06-14-2023 and was submitted to the Office by the provider on 06-19-2023.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During an off-site inspection, the Office reviewed an incident that occurred on 06-04-2023 and was submitted to the Office by the provider on 06-07-2023..

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-4(a)(h) by not terminating a seclusion episode when the client was de escalated and not having clinical justification for a seclusion that went longer than 4 hours and not documenting a seclusion episode. During the inspection a client was away from peers for 5 hours even though they were no longer escalated. There was also no clinical justification for the seclusion and staff did not document in detail the seclusion episode.

inspection_findings.description: Medication and hazardous items maintenance and storage
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-8(3) by having an aluminum can, potentially hazardous, available to clients. In the indoor arena an aluminum can was found accessible to clients who have a history of self harm. This is a repeat noncompliance as noted on 7/9/2024.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8(b) by not maintaining plumbing and  electrical and in safe condition. During the inspection walkthrough there was a broken sink and broken electrical outlet covers.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident within one business day. During the inspection a critical incident happened on 9/4/2024 and was not reported to the Office of Licensing until 9/13/2024. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 07/11/2024 and was not reported until 07/15/2024.
This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by providing supervision to staff requiring supervision. During the inspection on 7/9/24, the licensor observed staff members who had background checks "in process" weren't being supervised.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not following their policy of using physical restraint to protect the consumer from immediate harm. During the inspection a client was placed into a restraint that was not an immediate threat to self, others, or property.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a critical incident by the next business day. The incident occurred on 3/27/2024 and was reported on 4/1/2024. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a critical incident by the next business day. The incident occurred on 3/27/2024 and was reported on 4/1/2024. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a critical incident by the next business day.  The incident occurred on 2/22/2024 and was reported on 2/27/2024.
This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident within one business day.  The incident occurred on 12/29/2023 and it was reported on 01/04/2024.  This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by mistreating and compromising the health and safety of a client. During an on-site inspection, licensors conducted interviews and observed facility video coverage of a physical restraint incident. The evidence substantiated that a staff member bit a client during a physical restraint incident in response to the client aggressively engaging with the staff; the client incurred an injury as a result.

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by allowing a person with a denied background screening to work with clients. During on and off-site inspections, the evidence substantiated that a staff member’s background screening was denied on 08/31/2023. Provider documentation, multiple interviews, and facility video coverage verified that the staff member with the failed background screening worked on 10/06/2023.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff physically mistreating a client. During an on-site inspection, licensors conducted interviews and observed facility video coverage. The evidence substantiated that a staff member compromised the health and safety of a client by holding the client’s head and neck down towards their chest during a restraint. This is not an authorized technique and compromised the client’s breathing. During this restraint, facility video coverage documented the staff aggressively rubbing their hand in the client’s face.

inspection_findings.description: Maintain 1 staff to every 4 client ratio
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide direct supervision that meets staff to student ratio requirements of 1:4. During an on-site inspection, the licensors observed 2 client groups with staff to student ratios of 1:9 and 1:6. The direct care staff were therapists holding therapy groups and the other direct care staff were supervising clients in other areas on the property.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report two allegations of child abuse by staff to Child Protective Services (CPS). During on and off-site inspections, multiple interviews disclosed that a staff member offered and provided vapes to clients, showed clients inappropriate photos on their cell phone, and had inappropriate conversations with clients about their sexual activities and illegal substances. A second staff member was alleged to have had inappropriate sexual conversations with clients, flirted with clients, and touched clients inappropriately. The two  allegations were not reported to CPS by the provider.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report two critical incidents to the Office of Licensing. During on and off-site inspections, multiple interviews disclosed two critical incidents involving client rights concerns. The provider was made aware of these allegations, looked into them, and did not submit critical incident reports to the Office of Licensing.

inspection_findings.description: Maintain 1 staff to every 4 client ratio
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide direct supervision that meets staff to student ratio requirements of 1:4. During an on-site inspection, the licensor observed three client groups with staff to student ratios of 1:11, 2:9, and 1:6.  Multiple interviews and documentation reviewed substantiated staff to student ratio noncompliance throughout the week and a half prior to the inspection..

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance by failing to provide direct supervision for a staff without a conditional or full clearance background screening. During on and off-site inspections, interviews disclosed concerns with a staff member’s behavior and background screening. A background screening check was conducted and substantiated that a staff who required direct supervision was not provided with uninterrupted visual and auditory surveillance. The provider was required to provide direct supervision since October 2022 and the staff has had unsupervised direct access to clients.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report five critical incidents to the Office within one business day. On 08/10/2023, the investigator reviewed five critical incidents that occurred on 08/04/2023, 08/05/2023, 08/05/2023, 08/06/2023, and 08/06/2023 respectively. The provider submitted these critical incident reports to the Office of Licensing on 08/08/2023.

inspection_findings.description: Maintain 1 staff to every 4 client ratio
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by being out of ratio. In the facility, there were two groups that were outside the client- to-staff ratio.

facility_name: Rite Of Passage dba Willard Peak Residential Treatment

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with the rule by not having all prescription medication in its original pharmacy packaging during the inspection. This rule non-compliance is a repeat non-compliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide direct supervision of clients during sleeping hours. During an off-site inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that all direct care staff are sleeping and not conducting checks as frequently as required. While staff were asleep, a client ran away from the campsite in the middle of the night. The staff were unaware the client was missing until they woke up the following morning.

facility_name: SRS Education, Inc dba Storm Ridge Boys
SRS Education, Inc dba Storm Ridge Ranch, Girls
facility_address: 103 S Storm Ridge Ln, Elsinore, UT, 84724

facility_name: Solacium Sunrise, LLC dba Sunrise RTC - The Fields

inspection_findings.text: The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8 (1)(a)(b) by not maintaining cleanliness of the building  and furnishings are maintained in operating order and in a clean and safe condition,. During the walkthrough inspection there is a cleanliness issue in client bedrooms, broken furniture in client living areas. This is a repeat non-compliance as noted on 12/05/2024 and 02/25/2024.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a-d) by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 04/06/2025 and was not reported until 04/08/2025. 
This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 01/05/2023, 10/10/2023, & 11/12/2024.

inspection_findings.description: Provider shall protect clients from abuse, prevent abuse
inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-5(4) by staff members acting in a way that compromised the health and safety of a client. During the investigation, staff failed to secure a pair of scissors that were not being used. A client with a history of self-harm used the scissors to self-harm which resulted in medical care beyond basic first aid. This is a repeat noncompliance previously noted on 07/25/2023.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring a client was free from potential harm. During the investigation, the Licensee documentation and multiple interviews substantiated that a client gained access to an unlocked medical room and ingested medication that was not prescribed to them.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff not providing supervision commensurate with a client’s needs and behaviors. During an investigation inspection, the information gathered substantiated that a client who was on a higher level of supervision, obtained a staff cell phone, and used it inappropriately while unsupervised.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by supervising staff who required direct supervision. During the inspection on 12/5/24, the licensor observed staff member requiring direct supervision was not being supervised.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not performing direct supervision with line of sight check-ins every 15 minutes. During an investigation inspection, the information gathered from multiple interviews and provider documentation substantiated that a client was not provided with 15-minute, line-of-sight supervision. During this time, the staff were unaware a client left the treatment program. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring that each client is free from potential harm. During the investigation inspection, information gathered from multiple interviews and provider documentation substantiated that a client was able to leave the facility without staff knowledge and engaged in self-harm during this time. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by two staff members not performing direct supervision with line-of-sight check-ins every 15 minutes. During an investigation inspection, licensing observed two staff members 15-minute check documents at 4:42pm and again at 5:47pm. The staff had started their shifts at 3pm and had no documentation that 15-minute checks were completed. Interviews supported that staff do not consistently conduct 15-minute line-of-sight checks as required. This is a repeat citation.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing services and supervision commensurate with the behaviors and needs of each client. During an investigation inspection, multiple clients on a line-of-sight supervision protocol were left unsupervised and a staff observed the clients exiting the same bathroom together. On the same date, the clients took an inappropriate photo together. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not immediately reporting allegations of abuse to Child Protective Services. During the investigation, the information gathered from an administrative interview and allied agency documentation substantiated that an abuse allegation was made by a client on 10/04/2024 and the provider reported the allegations to Child Protective Services on 10/10/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 10/2/2024 and was not reported until 10/11/2024.
This is a repeat noncompliance.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text:
The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing supervision that was commensurate with a client’s behaviors and needs. During an investigation inspection, a client who was on safety watch obtained and ingested over the counter medication.

This is a repeat noncompliance

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not directly supervising a staff member who did not have a cleared background check. In the facility a staff member who did not have a cleared background check was working with clients unsupervised.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not performing line of sight check-ins every 15 minutes. During the inspection a client was able to leave the facility and went unnoticed for a period of 30 minutes. This is a repeat noncompliance to rule.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to maintain a staff-to-client ratio of one staff to every four clients. During an additional follow-up investigation inspection, the licensing investigator observed 2 direct care staff supervising 10 clients. The staff members were not able to verify they had conducted 15-minute checks. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to maintain a staff to client ratio of one staff to every four clients. During a follow-up inspection, interviews and provider documentation substantiated that 2 direct care staff were responsible for supervising 10 clients. This is a repeat citation.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide supervision commensurate with the skills, abilities, behavior, and needs of a client. During an investigation inspection, multiple interviews and provider documentation verified that a client, who had recently engaged in self-harm, was not supervised appropriately when they accessed a staff drawer, took a blade, and used it to self-harm.

inspection_findings.description: Direct supervision only by direct care staff
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide direct supervision to clients. During on and off-site inspections, multiple client and staff interviews disclosed that staff are often not in close physical proximity to all of the clients they are assigned to supervise and do not consistently perform line-of-sight check-ins no less frequently than every 15-minutes.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff acting in a way that caused severe harm to a client. During on and off-site inspections, the evidence supported that a staff omitted a safety measure that resulted in a client incurring multiple significant bodily injuries.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-19-3(3)(f), by staff failing to complete the required line of sight check-in with a client on March 26, 2025.  During the inspection, the investigator verified that staff did not complete a check for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff failing to perform direct supervision with line of sight check-ins every 15 minutes for a client.  The provider’s incident report indicated that supervision was a problem and staff lost track of the client between 7:15 and 7:40.

inspection_findings.description: Provider shall protect clients from abuse, prevent abuse
inspection_findings.text:
The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to protect the client from abuse, harm, mistreatment, or actions that compromised the client’s health or safety on 2 occasions.
1. During the investigation, a client disclosed that staff members overshared personal information with the client that was sexual in nature.
2. During the investigation it was identified that a staff member wrote several love notes to a client and nibbled the client’s neck.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff failing to perform a 15 minute checks. In the facility, during the evening of 05/09/2024 required 15 minutes checks were not completed and a client engaged in self harming behaviors.  This was a repeat noncompliance.

inspection_findings.description: Direct supervision only by direct care staff
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff failing to actively supervise with line-of-sight supervision no less frequent than every 15 minutes. During an investigation inspection, it was observed that the staff completed a check in on clients once within a 1.5 hour period.

facility_name: Sorenson’s Ranch School/Sorenson’s Ranch School Foundation

inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(c) by staff providing inappropriate images to clients causing potential harm. During the inspection it was confirmed that staff provided inappropriate images to clients. This is a repeat noncompliance as noted on 1/2/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide supervision commensurate with the skills, abilities, behaviors, and needs of each client. During the on-site inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that a staff member who was providing direct supervision for three clients, fell asleep for an undetermined period of time.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff member neglecting to provide necessary supervision to keep the client(s) free from potential harm. During an inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that the staff member was not providing active supervision when two clients engaged in inappropriate sexual misconduct.

facility_name: Southwest Behavioral Health Center - Horizon House East Residential (RT, DT & OT)

inspection_findings.text: The Licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a-d) by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 3/30/2025 and was not reported until 4/2/2025).

facility_name: Steps Recovery Center Of St. George LLC (3638 Sugar Leo Dr.)
facility_address: 3638 Sugar Leo Dr., Saint George, UT, 84790

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring applicants were directly supervised until the office issued conditional or eligible clearance determinations and not documenting how the individuals remained supervised for the entirety of their supervised employment terms. During the inspection, 2 employees required supervision in the Direct Access Clearance System and the provider did not have documentation of supervision for the employees.

facility_address: 11175 S Redwood Road, South Jordan, UT, 84095

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-8(1)(b) by not having all electrical outlets maintained. At the facility, during the walkthrough there was one electrical outlet that was missing its cover. This is a repeat noncompliance as noted on 10/29/2024.

The licensee was out of compliance with rule (R501-1-8)(1)(i) by having a prescription acne cream out in the med room without the original pharmacy packaging. During the walk through inspection, the licensor observed a a prescription acne cream out in the med room without the original pharmacy packaging. This is a repeat non-compliance.

inspection_findings.description: Medication and hazardous items maintenance and storage
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out compliance with this rule by not having potentially hazardous materials in a locked storage. At the facility, during the walkthrough there was a container of Clorox wipes out in the student room in the basement. In addition, there was a shed with hazardous material (gas and weed killers) in it at the one of the housing parents homes that did not have a lock. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having all electrical outlets maintained. At the facility, during the walkthrough there was one electrical outlet that was missing its cover. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not having all staff background cleared. At the facility, during a review of the DACS system it was found that one staff member that has worked for the provider for a long time did not have a background clearance in DACS.

inspection_findings.description: Medication and hazardous items maintenance and storage
inspection_findings.text: The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8(3) by not maintaining potentially hazardous items responsibly and with consideration of the safety and risk level of the population served. During the inspection, a steak knife was observed sticking out of a clients bedroom wall. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 04/23/2024.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8(1)(i) by not ensuring prescription medication is stored in original pharmacy packaging or individual pharmacy bubble pack together with the pharmacy label, directions, and warnings. During the inspection, it was observed that multiple pills were not stored in original pharmacy packaging. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 08/27/2024 and 12/19/2024.

facility_name: Telos Residential Treatment Center, LLC dba Telos RTC

inspection_findings.text: The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-19-3(f) by failing to perform direct supervision with line of sight supervision check-ins every 15 minutes. During the splitting of a group for activities, staff members did not confirm who had which clients and a client followed one group out the door and left the campus. Each group staff member believed the client was with the other group.

inspection_findings.description: Maintain 1 staff to every 4 client ratio
inspection_findings.text: The provider is out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide staffing to fit the ratio of one staff to every four clients. In the Fuji apartment on 10/05/23, there were 10 clients with 1 staff member when a critical incident occurred at approximately 7:45 AM.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a-d) by not reporting the critical incidents to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incidents occurred on 5/5/2025 and was not reported until 5/7/2025.

facility_name: The Hope Group dba Havenwood Academy, Inc.

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing supervision for staff with an unapproved background check. During the inspection on 7/2/24, the licensor observed that staff members requiring supervision were not provided supervision by the provider..

facility_name: The Hope Group dba Havenwood At The Ranch

inspection_findings.text: The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8 (1)(a) by not maintaining the appearance and cleanliness of the building so they are free from health hazards. During the walkthrough inspection bodily fluids were found on the wall.

The provider was out of compliance with R501-1-4(5)(a) by not using a trauma informed and the least restrictive restraint to control a situation. During the inspection and review of camera footage, it was observed by the investigator that a staff member acted outside their trained behavior management policy. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1)(c) by not protecting a client from potential harm. At the facility, a staff member a staff member grabbed the client by their head and threw them down during a restraint.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing supervision for staff with an unapproved background check. During the inspection on 7/2/24, the licensor observed that staff members requiring supervision were not provided supervision by the provider.

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not documenting how the individual was supervised for the entirety of their supervised employment term. During the inspection, the licensee was unable to provide documentation to verify a staff member was directly supervised.

facility_name: Therapy Associates DBA Star Guides dba Star Guides
facility_address: 377 E Riverside Dr, Saint George, UT, 84790

inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a) by not submitting a critical incident report to OL within one business day. During an investigation, the information gathered substantiated that a critical incident occurred on 05/12/2025 and was reported to the Office of Licensing on 05/16/2025.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report 2 separate critical incidents to the Office of Licensing. During an on-site inspection on 11/16/2023, multiple interviews disclosed that 2 days prior to the on-site inspection a client was hit and injured by another client. A second client was disclosed, that occurred 3 weeks prior to the on-site inspection in which a client was physically restrained by staff members. The staff members involved were aware of these incidents and failed to report them to the Office of Licensing.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to use passive physical restraint only as an emergency, temporary means of physical containment to protect the consumer, other persons, or property from immediate harm. During on and off-site inspections, multiple interviews disclosed that staff members conducted an unnecessary physical restraint for control rather than for safety; the client was not an immediate danger to themselves or others and was physically restrained for talking.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance for failing to report a client rights critical incident to the Office of Licensing. During an on-site inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that one staff yelled at, swore at, and physically mistreated a client and a second staff physically mistreated a client. The staff involved failed to report this as required by rule.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by mistreating a client, by compromising the health and safety of a client, and by failing to deter others from acting. During an on-site investigation inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that a staff yelled, swore at, pulled and shoved a client up a hill that needed a break during a hike. Other staff present failed to intervene and prevent the staff from pulling and shoving the client and an additional staff eventually assisted the first staff in pulling and shoving the client up the hill.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff using physical restraint as a convenience for staff. During an on-site investigation inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that two staff members physically restricted a client’s freedom of movement and normal access to their body. During this incident, a client was sitting and resting during a hike. The client was not a harm or danger to themselves or others. The client had a backpack secured to their body. The staff grabbed the client by their backpack and left shoulder, pulled the client to a standing position, and used the backpack to shove the client up a hill. When the client sat down to rest this happened a second time. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report an allegation of physical child abuse by a staff member to Child Protective Services (CPS). During on and off-site inspections, multiple interviews disclosed that a staff member was alleged to have physically mistreated a client. The provider conducted their own investigation and did not report the allegation to Child Protective Services.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by conducting an unnecessary physical restraint and using unjustified pain compliance on a client. During an on-site follow-up inspection, multiple client and staff interviews disclosed that staff failed to defer to the least restrictive method of behavior management available to control a situation. The evidence substantiated that two staff conducted a physical restraint on a client that was not an immediate harm to self or others. One of the two staff involved hyperextended the client’s joint and caused the client undue physical discomfort and pain. This is a repeat citation

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff physically harming a client. During an onsite follow-up inspection, multiple interview disclosures substantiated that pain compliance was used on a client that was not a harm or danger to themselves or others. A staff member used an unjustified pain compliance technique, and hyperextended a client’s wrist, which caused the client pain. This is a repeat citation.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report an allegation of client rights noncompliance by a staff member to the Office of Licensing. During on and off-site inspections, multiple interviews disclosed that a staff member was alleged to have physically mistreated a client. The provider conducted their own investigation and did not report the allegation to the Office of Licensing.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing adequate equipment or clothing for the environment. During the inspection it was learned that a client had soiled their day clothes and for two days hiked in sweatpants. It was also learned that clients are not provided more toilet paper when they run out before the next drop.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not conducting foot checks. During the inspection interviewed revealed that staff would check clients feet from a distance of 10-20 feet. These checks were done to ensure that client's had cleaned their feet.

inspection_findings.description: Body cooling available for temperatures over 80 degrees
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing water to cool the body. During the inspection staff and clients revealed that water is rarely used to cool the body as it is a "waste of water." Only when the clients are at a water source would staff consider allowing this to happen.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by having a staff not trained in CPR or first aid. During the inspection staff files were reviewed and there was no documentation that the staff was ever trained in CPR or first aid.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide direct supervision of clients during sleeping hours. During an on-site inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that all direct care staff were asleep while two clients ran away from the campsite in the middle of the night. The staff were unaware the clients were missing until they woke up the following morning.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule on 2 separate occasions.
The provider was out of compliance with this rule:

1. By failing to defer to the least restrictive method of behavior management available to control a situation. During on-site inspections, multiple interviews supported that several staff did not follow the behavior management system they have been trained in and conducted physical restraints on clients that were not an immediate harm to self or others.
2. By conducting physical restraints that caused clients undue physical discomfort and pain. During on-site inspections, multiple interviews supported that clients who have been placed in physical restraints are immediately and aggressively taken to the ground in a prone position and some staff use unnecessary pain compliance techniques. This is a repeat citation

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to submit critical incident reports to the Office. During an on-site inspection, the licensor found 2 separate incidents of staff members that were noncompliant with the provider code of conduct and client rights that the provider failed to report to the Office within one business day as required by rule. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff requiring clients to hike in temperatures above 90 degrees. During an on-site inspection, the licensing investigator reviewed a staff’s file. A record in this file, signed by the staff involved and one of the provider’s administrative team members, documented that the direct care staff made clients hike in temperatures in excess of 90 degrees fahrenheit.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule on 3 separate occasions.
The provider was out of compliance with this rule:
By neglecting to provide necessary health care by withholding prescription medication from a client. During an on-site inspection, the licensing investigator reviewed a client’s file. An incident report indicated a client’s medication was withheld for returning to the campsite from a hike later than the designated medication dispensing time.
By compromising the health and safety of clients when a staff failed to act and deter clients from acting. During an on-site inspection, provider documentation substantiated that a staff member was aware clients were going to run from the campsite. The staff failed to take safety precautions to prevent this incident from happening and instead laughed at the clients.
By a staff verbally mistreating clients. During onsite inspections, multiple interviews and provider documentation substantiated that a staff yelled at clients, called clients insulting names, and made threatening statements to clients.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff failing to follow the provider’s policy and procedure and client rights. During an on-site inspection, a staff file document was observed and recorded that the staff took naps during the day and failed to consistently supervise students in groups or out of sight.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff using an unnecessary pain compliance restraint technique. On June 6, 2023, during an onsite compliant investigation multiple interviews disclosed that a staff member used a pain compliance technique and acted outside of the providers policy and procedure and Utah Administrative Rule. The staff member initiated a pain compliance technique to a client that was not an immediate danger to themselves or others. The client was being passively resistive. The restraint resulted in undue physical discomfort and pain to the client. This was a repeated rule of noncompliance.

Incident occurred on 03/17/2023. The provider was out of compliance with this rule by using an unnecessary pain compliance restraint technique. During an onsite investigation inspection, on 03/27/2023, multiple interviews disclosed that a staff member acted outside of the provider’s policy and procedure and Utah Administrative Rule. The staff initiated a pain compliance technique on a client that was not an immediate danger to themselves or others; the client was being argumentative. The restraint resulted in undue physical discomfort and pain to the client. This was a repeat rule noncompliance.
