During an inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that the staff member was not providing active supervision when two clients engaged in inappropriate sexual misconduct on two separate occasions. Multiple interviews disclosed that one of the clients involved in both incidents has a history of sexually acting out against his peers.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining the building free from hazards. During the onsite inspection, this licensor observed in two different client bedrooms that there was a hole in the wall.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by placing a client in seclusion without justification. During the inspection multiple interviews disclosed that on at least 3 occasions, a client was placed in seclusion for being disruptive rather than for the immediate safety of the client or others.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a-d) by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 6/29/2025 and was not reported until 7/7/2025.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8(1)(a) by not ensuring the building is free from health hazards. During the inspection, the licensor observed three cans of paint were in a closet attached to the clients bedroom where the cans could be accessed by the clients. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 10/17/2023 and 10/29/2024.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-12(4)(a)-(c) by not ensuring that all required agreements are signed and maintained as part of the client record. During the inspection, one of the client files reviewed did not contain the required signed agreements as part of the client record. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 02/22/2024.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-15(10)(f) by not ensuring that personnel information includes each crisis intervention or critical incident report involving the individual. During the inspection, it was observed that staff files did not contain critical incidents that the individual staff members were involved in. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 02/22/2024.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-16(1)(a)-(u) by not ensuring each staff receives pre-serving training on all required topics within 30-days of being hired. During the inspection, it was observed that staff had not received training on multiple required topics within 30-days of their hire date. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 02/22/2024.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-16(2)(a)-(q) by not ensuring each staff member completes the required training topics each year. At the time of inspection, multiple staff members were missing required annual training. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 05/06/2024.

facility_name: Wildflower Mountain Ranch Residential Treatment Center for Girls

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by mistreating and/or exploiting a client. During an inspection and in staff interviews that followed, it was reported that a staff member told a client how to make an inappropriate drawing. The staff member described how to make the drawing look like the staff member. The same staff member also had the same client translate and respond to inappropriate voice text messages between the staff member and their friend.

facility_name: Youth Health Associates Inc dba Bridges Academy

inspection_findings.text: The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-13(5)(a) by not reporting private placements to the office by completing the congregate care out of state placement survey prior to the fifth business day of each month. During the inspection, it was observed that the month of February 2025 had not been reported through the required survey. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 05/21/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 2/6/2025 and was not reported until 2/8/2025.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a critical incident. During the investigation it was found that a staff member was fired for sharing a vape with clients. The vaping  incidents and subsequent firing of the employee were not reported to licensing. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff member sharing their vape with 3 clients and putting those clients in potential harm and mistreatment. During an inspection on 3-18-24, staff and clients were interviewed. Documents were later gathered. Staff confirmed a former staff member provided a vape for clients use. This is a repeat citation.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff member sharing their vape with a client, which led to at least 3 clients using the vape and putting those clients in potential harm and mistreatment. During an inspection on 2-5-24, staff and clients were interviewed. Staff and clients confirmed a former staff provided a vape for clients use.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. The incident was occurred on 10/21/2023 and did not submit the report to Licensing until 10/26/2023.  This was a repeat non-compliance.

facility_name: Youth Health Associates Inc dba Manti Academy

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report the alleged sexual misconduct to Child Protective Services. During an investigation inspection on 08/16/2023, the provider admitted the alleged sexual misconduct was not reported to Child Protective Services.

facility_name: Youth Health Associates dba Cedar Valley Ranch

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a) by not reporting a critical incident within one business day. During the investigation an allegation of significant criminal activity was made on or around 5/21/2025. An incident report was not made to licensing until 5/23/2025. This is a repeat noncompliance as noted on 3/12/2025, 7/3/2024, 10/5/2023, 8/22/2023, and 8/21/2023.

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text: The licensee was out of compliance with R501-14-5(2)(b) by not directly supervising a staff member without a cleared background. During the inspection a staff member whose determination had not been made was left unsupervised with clients.

The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-8 (a, b) by not maintaining the appearance and cleanliness of the building so it's free from health and safety concerns. During the inspection, the building was in disrepair with multiple broken windows, holes in walls, and client areas were not clean.

The licensee was out of compliance with R380-600-7(16)(a) by not reporting a critical incident within one business day. During the inspection the licensee was aware of a critical incident on 3/3/2025 but did not submit a report until 3/7/2025. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 7/3/2024, 10/5/2023, 8/22/2023, and 8/21/2023.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not conducting physical 15-minute check-ins with clients. During the inspection a client was able to leave the facility without staffing being aware. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining the building, electrical furnishings and appliances. During the inspection the bathroom in school was not vented by mechanical means, the door to the house had been broken, in a client bedroom the light fixture had no cover exposing fluorescent light bulbs, the living room light was non-functional, there was a broken electrical plug by staircase and the stove top in the was kitchen broken. This is a repeat non-compliance.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not supervising clients based of their behavior. During the inspection clients, who had previously sexually acted out with peers, were able to sexually act out with peers again. This is a repeat noncompliance.
The provider was out of compliance with this rule by exposing a client to potential harm. During the inspection a client fell from a staff vehicle and sustained injuries.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing supervision based off of clients behaviors. During the inspection clients were not supervised based of behaviors that they had previously demonstrated. This is a repeat noncompliance.

inspection_findings.description: Services and supervision to meet each clients needs
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not providing supervision as required by a client's behavior. During the inspection a client with a history of sexually acting out was able to sexually act out with a peer. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 06/29/2024 and was not reported until 07/02/2024.
This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not removing all glass pieces from a  broken window. During the inspection the licensor saw a  broken window facing the outdoor basketball court that had small unattached glass particles around the window..

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by a staff failing to provide supervision commensurate with clients behaviors and needs on multiple occasions. During an on-site investigation inspection, multiple interviews and provider documentation substantiated the following incidents of noncompliance.
1. A staff member left their assigned post and area leaving clients without supervision. During this time, two clients engaged in sexual activity, and 
2. A staff member failed to supervise clients and was focused on a cell phone. During this time, clients left the staff’s supervision and engaged in sexual activity.
Upon discovery of these incidents, the provider took prompt action to address the noncompliances.

The provider was out of compliance by a staff failing to remain awake and appropriately supervise clients to ensure health and safety. During an on-site investigation inspection, multiple interviews disclosed that a staff member intentionally takes naps on the couch during their assigned shifts.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a change to the clients’ environment that compromised their immediate health and safety. During an on-site investigation inspection, the licensor observed the laundry room and staircase walls were missing. Multiple interviews disclosed an environmental hazard in which a water leak resulted in mold contamination in the walls. This incident was not reported to the Office of Licensing.

facility_name: Youth Health Associates Inc dba Eagle Academy

inspection_findings.text: The Licensee was out of compliance with R501-1-13(5)(a) by not reporting private placements to the office by completing the congregate care out of state placement survey prior to the fifth business day of each month. During the inspection, it was observed that multiple months in the last year had not been reported through the required survey. This was a repeat noncompliance as noted on 09/12/2023 and 05/21/2024.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring all prescription medications stored on site are stored in original pharmacy packaging or individual pharmacy bubble pack together with the pharmacy label, directions, and warnings. At the time of inspection, a prescription medication was outside of the required pharmacy packaging. This is a repeat rule noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring all prescription medications stored on site are stored in original pharmacy packaging or individual pharmacy bubble pack together with the pharmacy label, directions, and warnings. At the time of inspection some of the prescription medications were observed in a plastic bag and not contained in packaging with the pharmacy label, directions, and warnings. This is a repeat rule noncompliance.

facility_name: Youth Health Associates Inc dba Lakeside Academy

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not ensuring each staff completes annual training on general provisions and applicable categorical licensing rule, as well as training on managing funds for clients and identifying signs and symptoms of clients under the influence of substances and alcohol. At the time of inspection staff files did not contain any documentation showing they had been trained on these required topics. This is a repeat noncompliance.

inspection_findings.description: Provider shall protect clients from abuse, prevent abuse
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with R380-80-5(4) by compromising the health and safety of the clients. During the inspection, it was reported by clients that the staff were not present in the basement, where the clients were able to engage in sexual misconduct. This is a repeat noncompliance.

inspection_findings.description: Provider shall comply with policies and safe practices
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with R380-80-5(3) by failing to comply with applicable written policies. During the inspection, it was reported by clients that they were able to engage in misconduct without appropriate supervision as stated in the provider’s policies. This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider is out of compliance with rule by failing to keep clients free from acts of violence. While on site 01/07/2025, it was reported by staff and clients that a client had been harmed by staff. The investigator observed a bruise on the client’s ear.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not reporting a critical incident to the Office within one business day. During review of critical incidents it was identified that the incident occurred on 08/04/2024 and was not reported until 08/06/2024.
This rule was previously out of compliance on: 02/14/2023, 06/06/2024, 10/05/2023, 11/13/2024, and 04/01/2024.

This is a repeat noncompliance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a critical incident within 1 business day. During the inspection a critical incident happened on 3/28/2024 and was reported to Licensing on 3/30/2024. This is a repeat noncompliance.

inspection_findings.description: Provide direct supervision that meets supervision and ratio requirements
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining adequate supervision of clients.  During the inspection, the Licensor interviewed staff and identified that in the program two clients were able to leave supervision and participate in sexual activity while unsupervised. This is a repeat citation.

inspection_findings.description: Provide direct supervision that meets supervision and ratio requirements
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining adequate supervision of clients.  On 11/15/2023 at the program, two clients were able to leave supervision and participate in sexual activity while unsupervised. This is a repeat citation.

inspection_findings.description: Provide direct supervision that meets supervision and ratio requirements
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide direct supervision. In the facility two youth left supervision and engaged in inappropriate sexual contact while unsupervised. This is a repeat citation.

inspection_findings.description: Provide direct supervision that meets supervision and ratio requirements
inspection_findings.text: The program was out of compliance with this rule by failing to provide direct supervision.  In the facility two youth left supervision and engaged in inappropriate sexual contact while unsupervised.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by withholding and manipulating  information During on and off-site inspections, licensors reviewed 2 unrelated incident reports, written by staff members, that omitted client physical mistreatment. The licensors conducted multiple interviews, read witness statements, and reviewed information provided by allied agencies that substantiated client physical mistreatment occurred during both incidents.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by staff mistreating and acting in a way that caused serious physical injury to a client. During on and off-site inspections, multiple interviews disclosed and provider documents reviewed, substantiated that a staff conducted an unnecessary and aggressive physical restraint that resulted in serious harm to the client.
This is a repeat noncompliance issue.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule on two separate occasions by failing to comply with mandatory reporting laws by:
1. Failing to report that a child was physically mistreated and seriously injured by a staff member on 01/19/2022. Youth Health Associates did not report to the applicable investigative agency.
2. Failing to report an incident on or around 10/15/2023 in which a client set fire to an item in a neighbor’s backyard. This incident was not reported to the applicable investigative agency.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report a child abuse incident to Child Protective Services (CPS). During the inspection, licensors reviewed the provider report and collaborated with CPS. The evidence substantiated an incident occurred on 01/19/2022 in which a client was physically attacked by a staff member and was seriously injured as a result,.

inspection_findings.description: Licensed Program Complaints and Critical Incidents
inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by failing to report or accurately report critical incidents to the Office of Licensing. During off-site inspections, licensors observed 8 critical incident reports that were not reported accurately or at all. These incidents included a client medical emergency as a result of reportedly smoking methamphetamine, an unnecessary and aggressive physical restraint that resulted in serious client injury, a physical restraint in which a staff punched a client in the face multiple times that resulted in client injury, 5 incidents of client sexual misconduct, criminal activity, and an AWOL incident. This is a repeat non-compliance concern.

inspection_findings.description: Submitting application for an initial background screening
inspection_findings.text:
The provider was out of compliance with this rule on 2 separate occasions:
1. by failing to submit an application no later than two weeks from the applicant becoming associated with the license. During an off-site inspection, licensors observed the DACS background screening system and noted that Youth Health Associates had not submitted an application for a staff member who worked at the facility.
2. by allowing 5 staff members without eligible background clearances to work without being directly supervised. During on and off-site inspections, licensors verified that the provider allowed 5 current staff, without eligible background clearances, to work without constant audio and visual supervision from a staff with an eligible background clearance.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by compromising the health and safety of a client. During an on-site inspection, licensors conducted multiple interviews. Evidence substantiated that on 10/30/2023, a client was made to sit on the floor of the van, without a seatbelt, while a staff member drove the provider’s van during an outing.

inspection_findings.description: No conduct that compromises the health and safety of clients
inspection_findings.text: The provider is out of compliance with this rule by a provider staff harming a client in an attempted restraint that occurred in the front yard of the house on 11/01/2022. The staff, Aaron Wade, was attempting to restrain a client and when the client hit the staff, the staff retaliated, and used his fist to strike the client multiple times in the face. The client received bruising on the face and a lump on his forehead from this incident. These injuries caused concern and staff took the client to seek medical attention off site on 11/03/2022.

The provider is out of compliance with this rule by failing to report to CPS and the Office of licensing, about the inappropriate use of force on a client by staff resulting in a client's injury. During an incident that occurred on 11/01/2022, outside in the front yard of the house, a client received visible injuries. These injuries occurred when staff, Aaron Wade, used his closed fist to strike the client in the face more than one time during a restraint. The house manager, Peniamina Mobley, reported to the Office of Licensing that the client did not sustain injuries and no first aid was needed. No report of client injury was made to CPS.

The provider was out of compliance with this rule by causing potential harm to a client. Witnesses reported seeing a staff strike a client in the midsection while engaged in a physical restraint on 12/29/2022.

facility_name: Youth Health Associates Inc dba Stepping Stones

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with this rule by not maintaining the appearance and cleanliness of the building. At the time of inspection, one of the client showers had a build up of residue and grime. This was a repeat non-compliance.
The provider was out of compliance with this rule/requirement by not having a clean and maintained facility.

facility_address: 8097 West 2000 South Building 4, Cedar City, UT, 84720

inspection_findings.text: The provider was out of compliance with R380-80-6(1(c) by a client being exposed to potential harm. During the inspection a client was able to take a staff members vape and prescription pills unnoticed.
